scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
CSS v2.1 is included in 3 national catalogues of recommended specifications. They belong to the Netherlands, Spain and Sweden.
The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of these Member States is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets. 

National catalogue the Netherlands: 
https://www.forumstandaardisatie.nl/open-standaarden

National catalogue Spain:
https://administracionelectronica.gob.es/pae_Home/pae_Estrategias/pae_Interoperabilidad_Inicio/pae_Normas_tecnicas_de_interoperabilidad.html#CATALOGOESTANDARES

National catalogue Sweden:
https://www.avropa.se/globalassets/dokument/open-it-standards.pdf?_t_id=1B2M2Y8AsgTpgAmY7PhCfg%3d%3d&_t_q=standards&_t_tags=language%3asv%2csiteid%3a95d515a5-23ca-47bf-87a9-07b10d8ac360&_t_ip=178.139.72.144&_t_hit.id=Avropa_Core_Models_Media_GenericMedia/_ff07d720-f793-44b0-994d-27e79b28f6bd&_t_hit.pos=7

NIFO factsheets:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
CSS is a simple mechanism for adding style (fonts, colours, spacing...) to web documents, but by itself, it does not publish data on the web. Also, it does not comply with the other levels of maturity presented by Tim Berners-Lee's 5 stars for open data.

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

Five star open data:
https://5stardata.info/en/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
W3C has a defined and publicly available Process for the Development and approval process of the specification as a recommended standard. Also, a clear Release Notes tracking the changes of the different versions is archived.

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/2018/Process-20180201/#Policies

statement:
W3C has a defined and publicly available Process for the Development and approval process of the specification as a recommended standard, including a public review.

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/2018/Process-20180201/#Policies

statement:
CSS is publicly available for implementation and study for free on W3C's webpage. 

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
The W3C Royalty-Free IPR licences granted under the W3C Patent Policy apply to all W3C specifications, including CSS v2.1.

W3C Patent practice:
https://www.w3.org/TR/patent-practice#ref-AC

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a royalty-free basis
statement:
The W3C Royalty-Free IPR licences granted under the W3C Patent Policy apply to all W3C specifications, including CSS v2.1.

W3C Patent practice:
https://www.w3.org/TR/patent-practice#ref-AC

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
CSS is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language like HTML. CSS is a cornerstone technology of the World Wide Web. CCS v2.1 went to proposed recommendation on 12 April 2011. After being reviewed by the W3C Advisory Committee, it was finally published as a W3C Recommendation on 7 June 2011 and it has been used for the development of many webs. Therefore, the maturity of the specifications is widely demonstrated.

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
CSS v2.1 has had market acceptance for unified web design for years used with HTML which is widely accepted, but with the release of the CSS3 version that uses CSS v2.1 specification as its core, its use has been reduced. CSS3 has implemented some modules and functionalities of the CSS v2.1 specification. Moreover, some modules of CSS3 have been accepted as standard by W3C, for example: CSS Colour Module Level 3 (W3C Recommendation 06 November 2018). 

CSS v2.1 W3C reference: 
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/ 

CSS Color Module Level 3 W3C reference: 
https://www.w3.org/TR/2018/REC-css-color-3-20180619/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
CSS v2.1 has been used to develop innovative solutions in the past, but with the new version CSS3, all web solutions that want to be developed with CSS use the latest version because it is more efficient and has more features.

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

CSS Color Module Level 3 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2018/REC-css-color-3-20180619/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
CSS is maintained by W3C which is an international community developing open standards. 

Developer community W3C:
https://www.w3.org/Consortium/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
The purpose of CSS is to give format to web documents, including layout, colours and fonts. Therefore, it allows to improve the visualization so that the information is friendlier and its interpretation is easier.
An example of this is EUR-Lex, the cross border gateway to EU Law. It is using CSS to present the different documentation contained in EUR-Lex.

Presentation style sheets EU Vocabulary:
https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/presentation-style-sheets

EUR-Lex:
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/homepage.html?locale=en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the comprehensibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
The purpose of CSS is to give format to web documents, including layout, colours and fonts. A well-formatted web document helps the public administration to make the information more comprehensible. Without a CSS, the information could be confusing and it could take longer to see the meaning of the information.
An example of this is EUR-Lex, the cross border gateway to EU Law. It is using CSS to present the different documentation contained in EUR-Lex. 

Presentation style sheets EU Vocabulary:
https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/presentation-style-sheets

EUR-Lex:
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/homepage.html?locale=en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification helps to ensure the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement:
The purpose of the specifications is not related to the availability of interfaces with internal information systems. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification. In the case that there would be an interface with HTML, this specification could help to ensure the availability of interfaces giving the correct format.

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.
statement:
CSS v2.1 is a business domain agnostic specification that can be reused in a cross-domain manner.

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. statement:
CSS v2.1 is publicly available for implementation and use for free on W3C's webpage. Therefore, it can be reused by the organizations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

statement:
CSS can be found for free along within the European Collaborative Platform, Joinup.

CSS in Joinup platform:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/cascading-style-sheets/distribution/cascading-style-sheets

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is independent of any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
CSS v2.1 is dependent from HTML, its main function is to describe how HTML elements should be displayed on web documents.

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
The purpose of CSS v2.1 is to give format to web designs, thus, the use of the specifications does not hamper the scalability of systems. By using CSS v2.1, administrations, citizens or businesses can visualize data over the Internet. If the environment grows or changes, CSS can be adapted without creating harm over the solution.

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
The purpose of CSS v2.1 is not related with data portability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable for this specification. 

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
The purpose of CSS is not related to the once-only principle. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement:
By providing style, the CSS is an asset that when used properly could help to enhance and ease the accessibility of disabled people. It could help to provide context and support the functionalities of the web design. Moreover, the Regional Government of Bizkaia developed his website to promote the integration of groups with disabilities into the Public Administration of Bizkaia. They used XHTML 1.0 recommendations and CSS2.

CSS and JavaScript accessibility best practices:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Accessibility/CSS_and_JavaScript

CSS2 implemented in e-accessability project:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/einclusion/document/eaccesibility-public-administration-bizkaia-bizkaianet

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
The purpose of CSS is not related to security and privacy of the data exchange. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement:
The purpose of CSS v2.1 is not related to the delivery of multilingual public services. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
The specifications is not directly related with the data exchange, but it could be used to provide user-friendly appearance and detail to those public services accessible via HTML. CSS could support the implementation of digital services avoiding the non-digital ones. 

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement:
The purpose of CSS v2.1 is not related to long term preservation of electronic records. Therefore, this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification. 

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are existing documentation and studies assessing the effectiveness and efficiency of CSS v2.1. It is a comparison between 3 versions, CSS, CSS2 and CSS3. As well, the study shows the improvement of the different versions over time as resulting in more efficient and faster web designs.

Comparison CSS2 and CSS3:
https://hackr.io/blog/difference-between-css-css2-and-css3

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
CSS v2.1 is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, CSS can define the interoperability aspects of the "Human Interface" ABB of the EIRA Technical Application View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
W3C provides a Markup Validation Service for free to validate CSS, and (X)HTML using style sheets.

W3C Markup Validation Service:
https://validator.w3.org/

Online CSS validator:
https://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification is recommended by an EU Member State.
statement:
8 Member States are recommending CSS2 v2.1 in their ICT National Catalogues. This Member States are Croatia, France, Malta, the Netherlands, Norway, Poland Spain and Sweden.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
CSS is currently being used by the EUR-Lex, the European gateway to EU Law for the presentation of the different types of documents that it includes. EUR-Lex is run by the Publications Office of the European Union with the aim to provide official and comprehensive access to EU legal documents. 

Presentation style sheets EU Vocabulary:
https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/presentation-style-sheets

EUR-Lex:
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/homepage.html?locale=en

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
The specification is included in 8 Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications. This Member States are Croatia, France, Malta, the Netherlands, Norway, Poland Spain and Sweden.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, there is no evidence of the inclusion of CSS v2.1 within any European catalogue of standards.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidences have been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of CSS is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
The purpose of CSS is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
CSS does not define a cross-sector reusable data model. Instead, it defines a set of conventions and rules to provide style to web documents. 

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
CSS is a simple mechanism for adding style (fonts, colours, spacing...) to web documents, but by itself, it does not publish data on the web. It also does not comply with the other levels of maturity of Tim Berners-Lee's 5 stars for open data nor the principles of the linked open data.

CSS v2.1 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-CSS2-20110607/

Five star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
